intro: Hypenia subrosea, commonly known as the rose-flowered hypenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from pale pink to white. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Hypenia subrosea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
